page.title: 01COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: SOCIAL CONCERNS COMMUNITY COUNCIL WE WENT TO A COMMUNITY COUNCIL MEETING ON MONDAY THE TWENTY NINTH OF APRIL. THE MAIN DISCUSSION POINTS ARE THAT THE CHARGES FOR SKIPS ARE LEVELLED OUT.COUNTRY PEOPLE CAN'T GET JOBS IN LERWICK BECAUSE OF THE FEW BUSES THAT RUN.THEY WANT THE BUSES TO GO MORE REASONABLE TIMES AND THEY WANT IT NEARER WORKING TIMES.THE BURRA BRIDGE WILL BE PAINTED THIS SUMMER AND THE TRONDRA ONE WILL BE PAINTED NEXT SUMMER.THE PAPAL CHURCH IS GOING TO BE LOOKED AT TO SEE IF IS PREHISTORIC.TWO NEW SIGNS ARE GOING TO BE PUT UP AT ROADSIDE.ONE AT THE MUCKLE ROAD SAYING SLOW.THEY HAVE GOT A NEW POLICEMAN FOR SCALLOWAY FOR WHEN THE OTHER ONE GOES. THERE IS GOING TO BE A CAR PARK NEXT TO THE HAMNAVOE PUBLIC HALL.
